comment.body: On one of the torrent sites maybe? Or you build your own Jazz Torrent site :) Uploading the files directly to ZeroNet would only end up in endless loading times.
Nope the hubs all work the same afaik - but nothing stops you from building your own hub.
@Flyman: Lol
These old technophobe politicians do not understand how the internetz works. Good thing they don't get younger...
So it is basically a democratic github? If you could implement that on ZeroNet then it will be as democratic as it can get.

@Plasmmer: You know where a voting feature would be really helpful? For sites (e.g. filesharing) that are accepting user generated content (links, descriptions,...). So that before submissions get published, the owner and other authorised users could either approve or reject to prevent spam & duplicates.
@Plasmmer: That's right.
Signal https://support.whispersystems.org/hc/en-us/articles/212940158-How-can-I-donate-
TOR https://donate.torproject.org
Wikileaks https://shop.wikileaks.org/donate

@Flyman: Watch some documentaries - e.g. from Adam Curtis, e.g. [The Century of The Self](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Century_of_the_Self) or [Hypernormalisation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HyperNormalisation_(film)), also I can recommend Noam Chomsky's [Manufacturing Consent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manufacturing_Consent)
Can I have some of what you are smoking?

@Plasmmer: Never did it - check out the post from @Kaffie: @ http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1BLueGvui1GdbtsjcKqCf4F67uKfritG49/16nArdxrSaNThNp83kL8E6NLL9WD98iUne/3

Also, use the search feature on ZeroHello  to see if anyone already asked that question.
@Plasmmer: May be the space in his name

@Plasmmer: To clone a site, you should generally create [a blank one](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/using_zeronet/create_new_site/) (I find via command line easiest)and then copy the folder of the site you want to clone to your new directory BUT do NOT overwrite the content.json
Can happen when you don't have enough seeders. Opening the port can help but it also works without, only takes longer.
@Plasmmer: That's what did it for me. Also, if you  using TOR you won't need to open any ports
@Flyman: I can also give you a magnet link if you want :) I watched all 4 parts and then "Hypernormalisation", then everything is chronologically
@Flyman: I am glad you find it interesting :)
And ZeroNet is better with you! Welcome to the future @KsKarthik: :)
@kskarthik: no we don't have hashtags, but one day someone may add the feature. Things are changing quickly here :) data caps suck :(
There are other people here - please don't get discouraged by a few fools :)
No idea :( but your signature/approval  idea would be great on that page
@Rythyrix: That makes me actually wonder if it would be possible to run ZeroNet on wifi mesh networks.
Considered that there are 200 million more Chinese than English speakers in this world ZeroNet has quite a lot English I must say. You can moderate with the mute button  ;)

@Ranxerox: You are right people should pay more attention - some people just don't get it that English is the "main" international language. You can hit click on the user name that started the topic and then select "mute".

No seeders :( [Try this one](magnet:?xt=urn:btih:e6adb0f7ac5cee9e7594410ab67bfd8ecb3379d8&dn=The+Coming+War+On+China+2016+DVDRip+x264+AAC+&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.leechers-paradise.org%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fzer0day.ch%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fopen.demonii.com%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.coppersurfer.tk%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fexodus.desync.com%3A6969)
